etymologies: early 19th century: from French, formed irregularly from di-‘through’ + Greek opsis ‘aspect’, later interpreted as derived from Greek diopsis ‘a view through’

definitions: a mineral occurring as white to pale green crystals in metamorphic and basic igneous rocks. It consists of a calcium and magnesium silicate of the pyroxene group, often also containing iron and chromium.
shortDefinitions: mineral occurring as white to pale green crystals
